title: 106_s3
content:
The "Tax Cuts for All Americans Act" imposes a 10 percent reduction in individual income tax rates for married individuals filing joint returns and surviving spouses. This Act amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to lower tax rates. The tax rates based on taxable income are as follows:
- Not over $43,050: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $43,050 but not over $104,050: $5,811.75 plus 25.2% of the excess over $43,050
- Over $104,050 but not over $158,550: $21,183.75 plus 27.9% of the excess over $104,050
- Over $158,550 but not over $283,150: $36,389.25 plus 32.4% of the excess over $158,550
- Over $283,150: $76,759.65 plus 35.64% of the excess over $283,150. Heads of Households are subject to these tax rates. Heads of Households are subject to a tax on their taxable income according to a specific table. For unmarried individuals, the tax rates are as follows:
- Not over $34,550: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $34,550 but not over $89,150: $4,664.25 plus 25.2% of the excess over $34,550
- Over $89,150 but not over $144,400: $18,423.45 plus 27.9% of the excess over $89,150
- Over $144,400 but not over $283,150: $33,838.20 plus 32.4% of the excess over $144,400
- Over $283,150: $78,793.20 plus 35.64% of the excess over $283,150. Unmarried individuals (excluding surviving spouses and heads of households) are subject to a tax based on the following table for taxable income exceeding $283,150. For taxable income over $283,150, unmarried individuals face a tax rate of 35.64% on the excess amount. Married individuals filing separate returns have different tax brackets and rates based on their income levels. For married individuals filing separate returns, a tax is imposed on their taxable income according to specific brackets and rates. The tax rates for taxable income ranges from not over $21,525 to over $141,575 are 13.5%, $2,905.87 plus 25.2%, $10,591.87 plus 27.9%, $18,194.62 plus 32.4%, and $38,379.82 plus 35.64% respectively. The tax rates for taxable income ranges from not over $21,525 to over $141,575 are 13.5%, $2,905.87 plus 25.2%, $10,591.87 plus 27.9%, $18,194.62 plus 32.4%, and $38,379.82 plus 35.64% respectively. Estates and trusts with taxable income over $141,575 are subject to a tax determined by a specific table. The tax rates for different taxable income ranges are as follows:
- Not over $1,750: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $1,750 but not over $4,050: $236.25 plus 25.2% of the excess over $1,750
- Over $4,050 but not over $6,200: $815.85 plus 27.9% of the excess over $4,050
- Over $6,200 but not over $8,450: $1,415.70 plus 32.4% of the excess over $6,200
- Over $8,450: $2,144.70 plus 35.64% of the excess over $8,450. Inflation adjustment amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 include changing dates from 1992 to 1998 in various sections. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has inflation adjustment amendments that involve changing dates in various sections, such as Section 59(j)(2)(B), Section 63(c)(4)(B), Section 68(b)(2)(B), and others. Section 6039F(d), Section 6323(i)(4)(B), Section 6601(j)(3)(B), and Section 7430(c)(1) are amended. Subclause (II) of section 42(h)(6)(G)(i) is changed from "1987" to "1998". Subparagraph (B) of section 132(f)(6) is amended by substituting "calendar year 1992" for "calendar year 1998". Additional conforming amendments include changing "15 percent" to "13.5 percent" in section 1(g)(7)(B)(ii)(II) and replacing "28 percent" in section 1(h). Section 1(h) of the Code is amended to change the tax rates from 28 percent to 25.2 percent. Sections 531 and 541 are also amended to change the tax rate from 39.6 percent to 35.64 percent. Additionally, sections 3402(p)(1)(B) and 3402(q)(1) are amended to adjust tax rates to 7, 13.5, 25.2, and 27.9 percent. Section 3402(p)(2) is amended to change the tax rate from 15 percent to 13.5 percent. The tax rates in various sections of the Code are being amended, with changes from 28 percent to 25.2 percent, 31 percent to 27.9 percent, and 15 percent to 13.5 percent. These amendments will apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 1998, and to amounts paid after December 31, 1998.
